text: hey guys, quick question. We changed our branding and domain in HS a few months ago and the i just noticed that our tracking URLs using old domain are not working anymore (it's quite obvious why) and i can't seem to setup redirect for those URLs either coz HubSpot says that original URL domain is not hosted in HubSpot. What's the best solution to reactivate/re-enable those links if any?

Hi team

I am working on emails and coded my own drag and drop modules

I have recently had to replace all the image select fields with rich text snippets in order to add ?noresize param to stop the images resizing and becoming blurry

However the rich text snippet automatically puts the contents in a div.

Is there away to get the content of thr rich text snippet without using the default html div mark up it pulls in?
probably should ask this in the <#CES6JU0RY|drag-drop-email-beta> channel
also, i think the image field should have an option to add noresize parameter.  email is the time when i most often employ noresize

thanks <@UD53A9UUR> I will move it over to that channel.

unfortunately the image select fields do not provide access to the url.
Hello, guys, iam sending a form trough api, how can i get the source data? the docu said something about activate a cookie to send this data, how can i do it?
hello people, anyone at HubSpot know why in a workflow I cannot copy a datepicker field (from 3rd Party) to a datepicker field I created?
I noticed this issue as well looks like it clones it as a page by default, same goes for blog templates :man-shrugging:
is there a limit to the number of pages one can create in the CMS?
Nope
Is the property that was created from the 3rd party a standard date field or is a datetime field
Hey <@UC2Q8ABAB> that would be in the `context` parameter listed here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form_v3>
says its a datepicker field
shows only date values

the UI will always show that, sorry I should have specified.  It’s possible through the API to make it a datetime property.  If you want you can send me the portal id and property name directly and I can look that up
Otherwise reaching out to HubSpot support directly will be your best bet
hey, Thank you, Zack, i just manage to implemented but iam not shure if i have to pass now the url data as paramters or the context with the hutk be itself get all the data
To get the source data, all you need is the hutk in the context paramater, HubSpot will figure the rest out
So is there a way that we can tell `{{standard_header_includes}}` to load without the `public_common.css` file?
i tried to a replace filter on it but doesnt look to be working
With building something with custom coded templates, I dont see the need to have to include this if its not needed
unless I am missing something and this is needed for other reasons
it has CSS for some built-in HubSpot stuff like the sprocket menu that is shown when viewing a page as a logged-in user
ah ok, then makes sense to keep it
thanks Gregory
<@U22VBL87M> couldn’t the sprocket menu css get loaded conditionally based on if the server knows the user is signed in?
the server doesn't actually know if you're logged in because you're logged into `<http://app.HubSpot.com|app.HubSpot.com>` not `<http://example.com|example.com>` (customer domain)
ahh
May be good to repost a link to this thread in <#CBZK16L9L|ftp-feedback> as they are thinking about and talking about local development a lot. <@UFH0PPMEW>

Slack isn't great (even with pins) at saving good convo/answers. We're exploring how to solve that.

In the meantime.... We should repost this conversation / links in <http://bit.ly/HubSpotdevform> so it can live forever and be found via google. Would that be something ya'll could do plllllleeeeaessseee :pray: <@U2H3TT8F2> <@U7V9DQ31P>

Thanks for the help <@UFBNA9K9A> :clapping:

Side note <@UC2Q8ABAB>, the <#C2YHAHB6K|api> or the <http://bit.ly/HubSpotdevform> are the best spots to ask questions, collaborate and learn about HubSpot API
:100:x:100:x:100:x:100:x:100:  :slightly_smiling_face:
can you combine it with the template&modules too? :pray:
Ohh, thank you very much, dint know :sweat_smile:
Thank u so much, Zack
No worries <@UC2Q8ABAB> :slightly_smiling_face: Just letting you know different options that may be faster to get help next time :slightly_smiling_face:
